activity.text:
> ### Bug: Whitespace Input Creates Empty Notes
> The `sanitizeNote` function returns an empty string (`""`) when its input contains only whitespace. This allows empty notes to be created, which contradicts the PR's goal of preventing empty entries from whitespace-only input. The function should return `undefined` in such cases.
> 
> `src/components/Questionnaire/structured/handlers.ts#L28-L32`

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12599
activity.text:
Cause:
The NotesInput component reads `notes = questionnaireResponse.note || ""` on each render. If the parent component (which manages responses) reuses the same questionnaireResponse object for a short moment before updating it (for example, when switching questions, or after an input event), the previous note value will appear until React propagates the new note value to the state and rerenders.


Give me a day or two ill try my best to solve the problem ill ensure that when switching questions or updating a note, the responses is immediately updated and that `NotesInput` is always fed the latest value.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12683
activity.text: I tried, `QuestionForm.tsx`, `QuestionRenderer.tsx`, `QuestionGroup.tsx`, `QuestionInput.tsx` passes `updateQuestionnaireResponseCB` to many child components (eg: MedicationRequestQuestion, MedicationStatementQuestion, AppointmentQuestion, EncounterQuestion, SymptomQuestion, DiagnosisQuestion, AllergyQuestion, FilesQuestion, etc). Each specialized question component might: Make API calls during mount, Set default values during initialization, Update values based on dependency changes, Update values based on actual user input. All of these scenarios trigger the same callback and marks the form as dirty. The best solution that i could come up with was to add a `isInitializing` state, and implementing a delay(500ms) before allowing dirty state changes, and updating conditions for enabling the submit button.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12411
activity.text: Following @Jacobjeevan's suggestion, I've made some UI changes. Hopefully, this was what he was talking about in slack. Since the html-to-image library captures the current state of an element, I believe this is the most practical solution. While it did require some UI adjustments, the generated PNGs are now visually consistent across devices. The resolution may still vary because the library captures the current rendered state, but this shouldn't be a major concern. If there's a better approach or if these changes need adjustment, please let me know

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12346
activity.text:
>  Date Input Scroll Behavior: The date input field supports mouse-wheel incrementing, but scrolling over it unintentionally scrolls the entire page instead of changing the date.
   Issue: Wheel events are not captured properly, making the feature unusable.
Pincode Input Risks/: The pincode input allows mouse-wheel increment/decrement, which can accidentally alter values (e.g., changing 123456 to 123457).
Risk: Could lead to incorrect data entry.
Additional Issue: No character limit enforced for the pincode field.

How about these problems?
